body_html:
Thank you for your feedback.

I make sense about the effects of the change of VLOG format.
How about the addition of the output switch parameter instead?

For example, environment variable TF_CPP_OUTPUT_VLOG_LEVEL is a switch parameter in this case.
If you specify TF_CPP_OUTPUT_VLOG_LEVEL=TRUE, you will get the log with VLOG level.
If you don't specify TF_CPP_OUTPUT_VLOG_LEVEL, VLOG level will not output.
This method will not break the exist users.

Is there any other idea to output VLOG level?
Or perhaps, this idea will not be acceptable?

body:
Thank you for your feedback.

I make sense about the effects of the change of VLOG format.
How about the addition of the output switch parameter instead?

For example, environment variable ```TF_CPP_OUTPUT_VLOG_LEVEL``` is a switch parameter in this case.
If you specify ```TF_CPP_OUTPUT_VLOG_LEVEL=TRUE```, you will get the log with VLOG level.
If you don't specify ```TF_CPP_OUTPUT_VLOG_LEVEL```, VLOG level will not output.
This method will not break the exist users.

Is there any other idea to output VLOG level?
Or perhaps, this idea will not be acceptable?
